greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of non-Hamiltonian labeled simple graphs with n vertices.
comment: A graph is Hamiltonian if it contains a cycle passing through every vertex exactly once.
xref: The directed version is A326220 (with loops) or A326216 (without loops).
Simple graphs with a Hamiltonian cycle are A326208.
Simple graphs without a Hamiltonian path are A326205.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jun 15 2019
ext: a(7)-a(11) from formula by _Falk Hüffner_, Jun 21 2019
